data.title: Interactive Director: Added commands don't display correctly on list + exception when removing them
data.body:
I mentioned this in the IRC the other day, and thought it might me related to the problem from the last thread, but it's persisted after that issue was fixed so it seems it's a different bug.

When I add a new command using the interactive director, a new line will show up on the list of commands, but it won't display the text saying what it is. Here's what that looks like:
![test_project1_-_autoreload_2017_10_06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12227163/31281095-5c7d5b90-aaa6-11e7-8db8-61e2dc34c703.png)

Additionally, if I then try to remove that line, I get the following exception:
```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 27, in script
    e "You've created a new Ren'Py game."
  File "renpy/common/00director.rpy", line 1279, in event
    rv = self.child.event(ev, x, y, st)
  File "renpy/common/00director.rpy", line 1248, in __call__
    renpy.scriptedit.remove_line(state.filename, state.linenumber)
KeyError: (u'lib/windows-i686/game/script.rpy', 27)

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 27, in script
    e "You've created a new Ren'Py game."
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\ast.py", line 624, in execute
    renpy.exports.say(who, what, interact=self.interact, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\exports.py", line 1158, in say
    who(what, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\character.py", line 911, in __call__
    self.do_display(who, what, cb_args=self.cb_args, **display_args)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\character.py", line 747, in do_display
    **display_args)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\character.py", line 523, in display_say
    rv = renpy.ui.interact(mouse='say', type=type, roll_forward=roll_forward)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\ui.py", line 287, in interact
    rv = renpy.game.interface.interact(roll_forward=roll_forward, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\display\core.py", line 2553, in interact
    repeat, rv = self.interact_core(preloads=preloads, trans_pause=trans_pause, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\display\core.py", line 3237, in interact_core
    rv = root_widget.event(ev, x, y, 0)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\display\layout.py", line 969, in event
    rv = i.event(ev, x - xo, y - yo, cst)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\display\layout.py", line 969, in event
    rv = i.event(ev, x - xo, y - yo, cst)

  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\display\layout.py", line 969, in event
    rv = i.event(ev, x - xo, y - yo, cst)
  File "renpy/common/00director.rpy", line 1279, in event
    rv = self.child.event(ev, x, y, st)
  File "C:\Users\Kuro\Desktop\Renpy\renpy\display\layout.py", line 232, in event

data.title: .13 performance x3 slow
data.body:
Ren'Py 6.99.13.2808 reload times are multiple times longer than the last stable version of renpy.

6.99.13: Reload duration 28 seconds
6.99.12: Reload duration 5 seconds

This is probably highly dependent on the game, but overall performance in .13 roughly x3 slower, from loading graphics to skipping, leading to slow development and user experience.

data.title: Update russian launcher
data.body: https://github.com/renpy/renpy/issues/1262

data.title: Translations need to be updated.
data.body: This is a bug that is intended to never be closed. It's here so translators can subscribe. I'll add comments to this issue when translations change after the initial prerelease of Ren'Py. The idea here is that translators can subscribe to this issue, so that github can email them when there's something to change.

data.title: Interactive director: Adding show command throws exception
data.body:
This doesn't seem to happen in all instances, but it does happen in some. I tested in some existing games and it seemed to work, but in others it seemed to error out. 
For simplicity's sake, I made a new game, copied Eileen's concerned sprite over, declared it, and then tried to show it on the first line of the game using the Interactive Director, and I got the following error:

```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 27, in script
    e "You've created a new Ren'Py game."
  File "renpy/common/00director.rpy", line 1274, in event
    rv = self.child.event(ev, x, y, st)
  File "renpy/common/00director.rpy", line 1053, in __call__
    update_ast()
  File "renpy/common/00director.rpy", line 438, in update_ast
    renpy.scriptedit.add_to_ast_before(statement, state.filename, linenumber)
Exception: Could not find unique first AST node.

Ren'Py 6.99.13.2808

I'm getting similar exceptions thrown for different actions, such as hiding images, and maybe this is all part of the same bug.

data.title: fix unlimited save slots count
data.body:
By default, user can scroll to the right and see a lot of pages for save/load screen. Some users report this like a bug in game.

Otherwise, I think is may be configurable by another value - like config.max_save_pages or some, for split number of visible pages from all pages count.

data.title: how to add new attribute to Character Class?
data.body:
## Context of the issue

I wan to make a screen like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11701668/31043571-16e17ca6-a5f1-11e7-93dd-a4fd876931ac.png)

Hurrie Cobber is a character name, and in order to show **Energy value** , **Intimacy value** and **presents list** , I would like to add some attribute into Character Class.

## Expected result

I could compile this kind of code in renpy.
``` python
define Hurrie = Character('Hurrie Cobber', color="#c8ffc8", energy_value="100" , intimacy_value="0" , presents=list["unpacked", "wine","ring"]) 
```

## Conclusion
I don't know if I could ask this kind of question here , or I should go to renpy's forum. lol.
Please give me some hints to fix it , thank you very much.

data.title: im_matrix() documentation
data.body:
Double *, no division
> These operations are invoked using the standard
    mathematical operators (\*, \*, +, and -, respectively). If two
    im.matrix objects are multiplied, matrix multiplication is
performed, otherwise scalar multiplication is used.

data.title: gui.show_name both in options.rpy and gui.rpy
data.body:
What's the difference? Working only options.rpy, 'cause gui.rpy initializing first.

gui.rpy:

/## Should we show the name and version of the game?
define gui.show_name = True

options.rpy:
/## Determines if the title given above is shown on the main menu
/## screen. Set this to False to hide the title.

define gui.show_name = True

data.title: 6.99.13 Prerelease Issues
data.body:
- [x] In the minigame, Eileen and Player's names are swapped.
- [x] In the minigame, the beep sound happens even if the game is not in progress.
- [x] Paper frame tiled has a rendering glitch.
- [x] Screenshots don't save with special characters in filepath https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=45862
- [x] .7z not uncompressing. https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/ucp.php?i=pm&mode=view&p=261581
- [x] What happens if we're in a read-only dmg on mac?
- [ ] Persistent files written by 6.99.13 may not be readable on 6.99.12.
- [ ] The director is slow in large games. #1265

data.title: ATL Issue in Nightly #2
data.body:
```renpy
transform test(what):
    what
    align (.5, .5)
    linear 1.0 zoom .1
    pause .25
    linear 1.0 zoom 1.0
    repeat
        
screen test():
    default val = 0
    bar:
        align (.5, .5)
        xysize 200, 40
        value val
        range 100
        thumb Fixed(test(Solid("#F00", xysize=(10, 40))), xysize=(10, 40))
        thumb_offset -10
        
    timer 1.0 repeat True action SetScreenVariable("val", min(val+1, 100))
    
label start:
    call screen test()
```
It doesn't crash anything but there is a notable difference in behavior between Release and Nightly. I think this has something to do with placing ATL in render (render.place) because a number of ATL we placed directly in renders in our CDDs are all acting very differently between the two version.

I don't have an example of the latter cause those take longer to isolate, kinda hoping that one will fix the other.

Issue here that thumb clearly does weird things in Nightly but is working perfectly fine in Release version.

data.title: ATL issues in nightly
data.body:
```renpy
transform test():
    easeout_circ 1.0 zoom .1
    pause .25
    easeout_circ 1.0 zoom 1.0
    repeat
        
screen test():
    add Solid("#F00", xysize=(100, 100)) at test
    
label start:
    call screen test()
```

data.body:
Issue with all transitions. OpenGL 2.0.
Using latest build for 2017-09-17.
In the nightly build for 2017-08-19 everything working fine (like in NPOT OFF)
Tech-info for GPU: https://www.techpowerup.com/gpudb/1233/i965gm

![2017-09-17_21-44-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24704640/30523975-da65453e-9bf3-11e7-9978-7c803bcc5ede.gif)

data.title: Fast skip issues with history log voices (h.voice.filename)
data.body:
When using Fast Skip, it seems that h.voice.filename always returns the same filename, which is the filename for whichever line the Fast Skip started from. Regular Skip does not have this issue.

Here's a test game to demonstrate:
[voice_history_test.zip](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/1308960/voice_history_test.zip)

I've added buttons for History, Skip, and Fast Skip to the quick menu. The History log uses h.voice.filename to replay voices when you click each entry.

Try using Fast Skip as soon as the game starts, then check the voices by clicking the entries in the History log. Every entry will replay the same voice file, which is the voice file for the very first line. 

I'm not sure if it's actually possible to record all the voice filenames during Fast Skip, but using the same file for all of them seems odd. I think that recording no file at all would be preferable to recording the same file over and over.

I tested in 6.99.13.2763. As always, let me know if you need more info.

data.title: Adding Drag objects to a screen.
data.body:
```renpy
image some_image:
    Null()
    linear .1 xpos 0
    repeat

screen debug():
    # add "some_image"

    draggroup:
        drag:
            droppable True

        add Drag(d=Solid("F00", xysize=(80, 200)), draggable=True)
        
label start:
    call screen debug()
```

This crashes the engine. If there is something on the screen that redraws itself as quickly as possible (.0), such as that image (commented out), everything is working perfectly normal (this may help with understanding the cause somehow).

In order to cause a crash, you must attempt dragging the red drag displayable.

**Traceback:**

data.title: ATL animations with dissolve getting cut off in NPOT
data.body:
Here's another potential bug (sorry for bombarding you so much lately! we've been doing a lot of game testing this month ^^). My example is kind of specific and rare, but I thought I'd report it just in case it's related to any larger NPOT issues. 

When NPOT is enabled, some of my ATL animations with internal dissolve transitions, such as the example below, get cut off at the bottom of the image. 
```
image animation_test:
    "images/sylvie_normal.png" with Dissolve(1, alpha = True)
    pause 1
    "images/sylvie_giggle.png" with Dissolve(1, alpha = True)
    pause 1
    repeat
```

Test project to demonstrate (when the image appears, wait 1 second to see the image get cut off at the bottom):
[NPOT_test.zip](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/1295321/NPOT_test.zip)

Some of my observations: 
- this only happens when NPOT is enabled; the animation acts normally after disabling NPOT
- "dissolve" may be the only transition that causes this issue (I had no problem with pixellate, blinds, or squares)
- the image size seems to matter; I wasn't able to reproduce this with smaller images (those shorter than screen height possibly?)

I tested in 6.99.13.2745. Also checked in an earlier version (6.99.13.2527), which did not have this issue. As always, let me know if you need more info and thanks for your help!

data.title: config.default_voice_sustain = True breaks voice!?
data.body:
`define config.default_voice_sustain = True`

breaks for me:

`voice "sample.ogg"`

(after adding "define config.default_voice_sustain" you need to do a "Delete Persistent", 
 last working build was from 2017-08-29. )

data.title: Viewport overflow with long texts
data.body:
Sorry, turns out I did run into another issue after all!

When I have a viewport with long texts, the bottom of the text overflows at certain scrollbar positions. At first, I thought maybe I made a mistake with the area or padding. But the overflow disappears/viewport looks normal at other scrollbar positions, which seems really strange. I don't think this behavior would be intentional?

I am testing in 6.99.13.2743. I tried in an older version (6.99.13.2527) and did not have this issue, so I'm guessing a relatively recent change caused it?

Here's an example script:
```
define e = Character("Eileen")

screen viewport_example():
    side "c r":
        area (100, 100, 600, 300)
        viewport id "vp":
            draggable True

            vbox:
                text "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum."
                null height 20
                text "Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi architecto beatae vitae dicta sunt explicabo. Nemo enim ipsam voluptatem quia voluptas sit aspernatur aut odit aut fugit, sed quia consequuntur magni dolores eos qui ratione voluptatem sequi nesciunt. Neque porro quisquam est, qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit, sed quia non numquam eius modi tempora incidunt ut labore et dolore magnam aliquam quaerat voluptatem. Ut enim ad minima veniam, quis nostrum exercitationem ullam corporis suscipit laboriosam, nisi ut aliquid ex ea commodi consequatur? Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?"

        vbar value YScrollValue("vp")

label start:
    scene bg room
    show screen viewport_example
    e "Here is a viewport with really long text. As you drag the scrollbar down, some of the text will overflow at the bottom."
    return
```

Example of overflow from that script:
![screenshot0033](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31723553/30261033-7e7fd816-967f-11e7-9800-01034e7d3f61.png)

As always, let me know if you need more information, and thanks!

data.title: More image glitches when changing resolution with NPOT
data.body:
Thanks again for the recent fixes! This is the last issue from me, hopefully. :)

This problem has gotten rarer since we last discussed it over PM on LSF, but even in the current nightly (6.99.13.2740), I'm still seeing a few glitches in NPOT mode when changing window size. I believe the glitches are appearing only in screens and custom cursors now (see examples below), but as before, it's hard to reproduce consistently.

Here's the test game I used to generate the screenshots below. The glitches appear randomly when changing resolution (fastest way is to repeatedly press the F key, though any method of resizing the window should work). 
[texture_test_2.zip](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/1290379/texture_test_2.zip)

In some cases, black rectangles appear on different parts of the screen. Some examples:

(black box in bottom right corner of main menu)
![screenshot0021](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31723553/30247441-be635b1c-95c9-11e7-8e79-1446d108f94c.png) 

(black boxes cover all the dialogue in the textbox)
![screenshot0023](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31723553/30247444-d7b551ba-95c9-11e7-910c-0cdc3596b969.png) 

(black boxes covering the icons in the quick menu)
![screenshot0030](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31723553/30247447-ed378d28-95c9-11e7-86e8-45c72a2e6045.png) 

In some cases, the rectangles look like distorted versions of other images. Some examples of rectangles covering the quick menu:
![screenshot0028](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31723553/30247450-13aa826c-95ca-11e7-9a66-3ecfec5b1f11.png)
![screenshot0029](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31723553/30247452-163d6f26-95ca-11e7-969b-584814f5dcf3.png)

I couldn't take a screenshot of it, but sometimes the custom cursor image also turns into a black or colored rectangle similar to the ones shown above.

As I said before, I think the issue is mostly with screens and custom cursors now - do they something have in common that could cause these problems? Let me know if I can provide any more information!

data.title: voice clips restart on "voice sustain"
data.body:
Thanks for fixing my last issue so quickly! Another issue I found in the latest nightly (6.99.13.2733): when using "voice sustain", voice clips replay from the beginning. I suspect it's related to [this recent commit](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/commit/c94d223b05fd8496898181d097c82f8e7d892d7a).

Below is a short example to demonstrate ("line.ogg" is in the attached ZIP). 
[line.ogg.zip](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/1287123/line.ogg.zip)

If you click to advance the text before the voice clip has finished playing, the voice clip will restart from the beginning when you reach the next line of text (right after "voice sustain"). I would expect the voice clip to continue playing without restarting, which is what it has done in the past.
```
define e = Character("Eileen") #, what_slow_cps=0)

label start:
    scene bg room
    voice "line.ogg"
    e "Once upon a time..."
    voice sustain
    e "...or what just seems like a very long time ago..."
    voice sustain
    e "...my father told me stories about the mermaids."
    return
```

Let me know if you need more information, and thanks again!

data.title: Translation update for custom resolution and russian
data.body:
Main feature: Custom resolution now translatable in launcher.

Other is just update.

data.title: Screen transform problem related to atl_st_offset
data.body:
In the latest nightly (6.99.13.2717), some of my screen animations are acting weirdly. In particular, transforms are restarting/repeating when they aren't supposed to. Here is a sample script to demonstrate:

```
define e = Character("Eileen") 

transform frame_trans:
    align (0.5, 0.5)
    on hide:
        linear 5 zoom 0 

screen test_screen():
    timer 0.5 action Hide("test_screen")
    frame:
        at frame_trans
        text "Hello." size 200       

label start:
    scene bg room
    e "You've created a new Ren'Py game."
    show screen test_screen
    e "This word will disappear in 5 seconds. Click to advance before the word disappears."
    e "If you keep clicking before the word fully disappears, the transform repeats."
    e "Hmm, I wonder what's going on?"
    return
```

I suspect [this recent commit](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/commit/b56772e148bebdf4687c9c675e51a44460f9bf38) for clearing atl_st_offset is related to the problem, since removing it makes my screens act normally again. Let me know if I should provide any more information, and thanks!

data.title: dialogue.tab has incorrect structure if in-game text contains "\n"
data.body:
"Export Dialogues" option produces `dialogue.tab` file with inconsistent structure if in-game texts contain "\n" escape symbol.

```renpy
e "Hello!\nHow can I help you?"
```
Produced file:
```
my_label_name_3bed98e0 [TAB] e [TAB] Hello! [NEWLINE]
How can I help you? [TAB] game/script.rpy [TAB] 15 [NEWLINE]
```
Note that the resulting file in a not a "table" (there is no proper columns due to "broken" lines).

Expected file:
```
my_label_name_3bed98e0 [TAB] e [TAB] Hello!\nHow can I help you? [TAB] game/script.rpy [TAB] 15 [NEWLINE]
```

RenPy version: 6.99.12.4.2187
